data.title: How to unlink email accounts
data.content: A newbie with a pixel 4a 5G for 4 days (Pixel2 for 3 years before). I made the cable transfer of my 2 to the 4a 5G, but now see that my gmail, Hotmail, and DropBox are linked in a group icon on the Home screen. How can I unlink these that I want to have separate

and i say again, when the phone is NOT CONNECTED TO ANYTHING.

data.title: Lose wifi connection repeatedly.... How can I fix it?
What is the fourth item in the Pixel 4a (5g) (and Pixel 5) camera cluster?
data.content:
The documentation Google has for the Pixel 4a 5g identifies the LED flash (top) and the main and wide angle lenses (left and right). But there's a fourth aperture there, at the bottom. What is it? An autofocus light? A depth sensor? Nothing, and it's just there to provide symmetry?

I noticed this because a lot of the third party cases use renders that have it as a third camera lens, and it's clearly not that.

label.camera: I noticed this because a lot of the third party cases use renders that have it as a third camera lens, and it's clearly not that.

data.title: Do u want to or not russanna yes or no
Warranty phone broken out of box
data.content:
My Pixel 4xl motherboard broke 3 months after the manufacturer warranty ended.  I purchased a BestBuy warranty with the phone so they sent me a new one and I would send back the old one.  

The new phone is also broken.  It does not charge.  It knows it's plugged in, saying 1hour 28 minutes to full but that's apparently a lie.  I have used a functioning wireless charger and the original charger. Less importantly when you restart it it just turns off.  It'll turn back on if you hold the power button for almost 10 seconds

label.battery_charging: The new phone is also broken.$It does not charge.

data.title: google assist keeps popping up even after being disabled and stopping music
data.content: When I plug in headphones using the USB-c audio adapter and go to listen to music on Spotify my phone keeps popping up google assist which I disabled and the sound cuts in and out and the volume bar pops up and will slide a little. I have been having this issue for almost a year and have bought numerous audio adapter that works for a little bit then stop, I have done everything I can find but it has had no effect. I have the Google Pixel XL 2 but I can't find much information about it but I have done everything up to turning off google assistance. This is my replacement phone they gave me as well. it was refurbished as well not a new phone. this is also a refurbished phone from google not a new replacement that they sent m for the warranty which i used to try and fix this issue.

label.google_assistance: When I plug in headphones using the USB-c audio adapter and go to listen to music on Spotify my phone keeps popping up google assist which I disabled and the sound cuts in and out and the volume bar pops up and will slide a little.

data.title: Ringing only one speaker, not stereo
data.content:
When I listen to music, music plays from two speakers. But when someone calls me or when a notification arrives, only the main (bottom) speaker works.
It seems to me that this is wrong, with calls and notifications, two speakers should also work.

label.speaker: But when someone calls me or when a notification arrives, only the main (bottom) speaker works.$It seems to me that this is wrong, with calls and notifications, two speakers should also work.

data.title: Why? my phone randomly on wifi assist. Never used it & after turned off, still kept auto connecting?
data.content: Adjust settings but somehow it adjusts back on

data.title: My pixel screen is blank
data.content:
Hello,

My pixel 2 screen suddenly stopped working. The screen is blank, but when I put my finger on the fingerprint sensor, there is hepatic feedback, which makes me think that it is fully powered on, but is broken or stuck on something. 

I've tried hard booting (press and hold power) and use safe mode (power and volume down), but none of these have yielded results. They did give the buzz that they've turned off/on when I did that.

Any ideas? Should I replace the LCD screen? Is it likely the battery is bad, or not giving enough power to the screen?

Thanks!

label.screen: My pixel 2 screen suddenly stopped working.$Should I replace the LCD screen?$The screen is blank, but when I put my finger on the fingerprint sensor, there is hepatic feedback, which makes me think that it is fully powered on, but is broken or stuck on something.

data.title: how can I get the weather.srchmbl.com off my android phone
Add 720p video-mode to Google Camera app
data.content:
The Google Camera app currently only offers 1080p and 4K recording modes:


1080p uses around 145MB of storage for every minute recorded; 4K around 340MB (both on 30fps, using H.265 codec option).

Could a 720p option be added to help reduce file-size?

Currently the only option is to resort to a third-party app to do this...

label.camera: The Google Camera app currently only offers 1080p and 4K recording modes$Could a 720p option be added to help reduce file-size?
